input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line
Copy directories recursively? Valid values: true Not supported with a Windows O/S

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">cp </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${recursive}') and '${recursive}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text>-r </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${preserve attributes}') and '${preserve attributes}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text>-p </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${force}') and '${force}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text>-f </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${source} ${destination}</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/xpg4/bin/cp </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${recursive}') and '${recursive}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text>-r </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${preserve attributes}') and '${preserve attributes}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text>-p </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${force}') and '${force}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text>-f </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${source} ${destination}</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">copy </xsl:text> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">${source} ${destination}</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>
